titles: Severall grounds, reasons, arguments, and propositions, offered to the Kings most excellent Majesty, for the improvement of his revenue in the first-fruits, and tenths annexed to the petition of James, Earl of North-hampton, Leicester, viscount Hereford, Sir William Farmer, Baronet, George Carew, Esq; and the rest of the petitioners for a patent of the first-fruits and tenths, for the term of one and thirty years, at the yearly rent of threescore thousand pounds.
author: Carew, George, Esq.
notes: Place of publication from Wing (CD-ROM edition).
Signed and dated at end: G.C. October the 5th. 1660.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: Church of England --  Government --  Early works to 1800.
Ecclesiastical law --  England --  Early works to 1800.
